website_summaries.verdict: With a subscription-free DVR, four tuners on board, and robust WiFi connectivity, this is the best value on the market today.
pros: Provides whole-home DVR with no subscription needed
Has two tuners for over-the-air reception from separate antenna
Connects to WiFi easily and has Ethernet input and USB port
Ongoing manufacturer support and upgrades keep firmware current
cons: Setup works best on iOS devices
can be kludgy on Windows or Android
Using an external drive may be a trial-and-error process

customer_reviews.title: Don't bother..................
customer_reviews.text: Same experience as a few others, was never reliable. I bought a used 4-channel Tablo. Sometimes it worked well however most of the time it froze and was unusable. Replaced it with a $26 Mediasonic Homeworx HW180STB and it works flawlessly. Using the same USB HD. No wireless for the Homeworx however it does have a HDMI port which provides much better quality (1080P) than the Tablo. I had to turn the Tablo to its lowest (frame rate/video quality) setting to get it to work at all. I suspect the Tablo had an intermittent defect as it would disappear from my home network randomly. Great concept poorly executed.
customer_reviews.author: FS

customer_reviews.title: Run away
customer_reviews.text: Not sure where all the good reviews come from. Followed directions for install and so far so good. Then it did a couple upgrades and have not had a working system now for 24 hours. Service support is only by ticket/email...they try to get back to you in 24hrs? Laughable support. Box gets extremely hot Google TABLO hot. Google TABLO connect problems. Search TABLO blue light slow flash.
customer_reviews.author: becesteve

customer_reviews.title: Wasted my money
customer_reviews.text: Struggled with setup. After 30 minutes on the phone with Tablo customer service they adjusted software that wasn't correctly set when I received it. Worked good for a few weeks. Had to set and reset several times. Hasn't work for the past week. Can't detect local channels I get with rabbit ears. Really wanted this to work. A real waste of $300 for the equipment and an additional $50 for the online guide. Not reliable and consistent service. Do not recommend purchase
customer_reviews.author: Jerseygirl

customer_reviews.title: Signifinantly less features without subscription
customer_reviews.text: Overall I like the product. However, the device loses a SIGNIFICANT level of features without the data guide subscription; you will not realize this until the 19 day trial period expires. Also, you must have a hard drive attached to watch multiple channels. Finally, the system crashes when trying to record TV channels with weak signals (less than four bars); make sure you have a good antenna.
customer_reviews.author: Rudy

customer_reviews.title: If it doesn’t connect with your WiFi right away, don’t hesitate to return it.
customer_reviews.text: Wouldn’t connect to my WiFi, so I contacted their support team. They kept having me try in different rooms of my house. They had me hard wire my internet to the Tablo. They delayed so long that I can no longer return it to Amazon. Now I’m stuck with a Tablo and Portable hard drive as paper weights.
customer_reviews.author: Rich Grindel

customer_reviews.title: Useless Without Internet Connection to Manufacturer Website
customer_reviews.text: Scanning for channel does not work without an internet connection to Tablo website. If the manufacturer ever stops support for the product or if it goes out of business then this product WILL BE USELESS since you will NOT be able to scan any channels. I have returned this product to get a cord-cutting device what will work even if the manufacturer is not around any more to support the product.
customer_reviews.author: TB

customer_reviews.title: Worst Product Ever!
customer_reviews.text: Product does not stay connected - continually needs to be rebooted. Often fails to record shows, yet show that they will be recorded. The guide is a joke as you do not get 2 weeks of guide presented in a easily readable fashion. Only 24 hours is presented in a normal guide fashion. The rest of the information for the two weeks in broken down into various categories which you have no control over. You are better off using a device that is either cloud based or is similar to TIVO. Not worth the money or effort to install!
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: Piece of Junk
customer_reviews.text: OK - where to start.... 1) Box gets SUPER hot 2) Wifi connection wonky - wired just as bad 3) Huge pixellation unless you drop down to low resolution (DOH - what's the point?) 4) thing is just plain FLAKY! Hate this thing. Hate myself worse for waiting to set up (since it was such a PITA) until the return period was over. Support absolutely no help whatsoever! One of the worst purchases I've made in a a while. Would sell on eBay - with less than an hour use, but I don't want to be responsible for someone elses terrible experience and ruin my rating!!!
customer_reviews.author: SusanS

customer_reviews.title: Can not be programed from Roku without buying a subscription.  Display design issues also.
customer_reviews.text: No non-subscription, time based, scheduling through Roku. If you control the Tablo from some other device you can still schedule it by time. Since we bought it for operation through Roku, the advertising appears to have been false. Also, In order to get it to work well with Roku, we needed to purchase a new, improved Roku. This product might have a future depending on the Tablo company and its willingness to serve all its customers. For now, the display design is awkward without a subscription. It also provides no method to work from simple text. It places useless and boxes all over the display. I like the parts of the product that deliver. Has potential.
customer_reviews.author: Jwaveve

customer_reviews.title: Cord cutting tool!  Makes cutting off cable a lot less painful!
customer_reviews.text: I'm really happy to have a DVR for my over the air stuff. It also allow me to stream wireless to other Smart TVs in the house without having to have an antenna for the whole house or one on each TV. Doesn't work very well with Roku, great with Fire TV. I just cut off the cable TV and this allowing me to record a lot of shows and the news to watch at my convenience. Really cool device and service.
customer_reviews.author: FXDawg

customer_reviews.title: Tablo 4 Tuner Model Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I can't say enough good things about this product. It's packed with all kinds of features, set up is a breeze, and the firmware is very user-friendly. I had an issue with what I thought to be the Tablo connecting to my router however, I called Tablo tech support, and they were super friendly and very helpful. As it turns out the problem was with my router and not the Tablo unit! I am very happy with the unit and especially happy with the great tech support. I am so impressed with this product and there tech support that this is the only review I’ve ever written.
customer_reviews.author: john ulrich

customer_reviews.title: Owned 5 months now. Don’t buy. Cut the cord - What a lie. Requires Tablo monthly extortion.
customer_reviews.text: Table talks about cutting a cord, but what they mean is use our cord. It’s almost useless without paying a new monthly fee to Tablo. Don’t buy. They give you 30 days to cover warranty and ability to return it, then Tablo cuts you off unless you succumb to their extortion. Now 33 days later I have a useless piece of crap because I will not pay their extortion. Also fast forward and reverse is poor. Only moves in 20 second intervals.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Schlosser

customer_reviews.title: Failed Recordings
customer_reviews.text: Good idea overall, but faulty software kills this product. About 4 out of 5 attempted recordings fail. The listed failure for the recording is "weak signal" yet I get full 5 dot signal on all the channels, and I can watch these programs live via tablo without any interruptions or degradation. I don't like watching tv live, (and tablo isn't good at that either due to slow channel switching) so the lack of reliable recording is a deal breaker. I strongly recommend avoiding this unit until these issues are resolved.
customer_reviews.author: James Simmons

customer_reviews.title: Going Back
customer_reviews.text: I live 6 miles from the transmitters.Live TV pixelslizes and sound cuts in and out.The signal strength shows strong,so they must have poor tuners.Could not tune 2 tvs too same channel without buffering problems.It was hooked up too the internet by a Ethernet cable.Had lip-sync issues also.
customer_reviews.author: Lord of Brooklyn Park

customer_reviews.title: Bad hardware. Would not hold a stable internet connection ...
customer_reviews.text: Bad hardware. Would not hold a stable internet connection for more than a few minutes via ethernet or wifi. I have two Tablo DUAL OTA DVRs with 64gb. Both work fine with same antenna setup and router (Netgear Nighthawk R9000). Only limitation of the Tablo Dual DVRs is that they can only tape 2 shows at a time instead of 4 with the 4-Tuner Tablo DVR -- if the 4-Tuner would work! Very disappointed with the 4-Tuner Tablo DVR and would not recommend this product. Read the other feedback and ratings. That's what I should have done.
customer_reviews.author: R.O.

customer_reviews.title: READ MY NOTES, YOU WILL NOT BE SORRY !!!
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT !!!!!!! WASTE YOUR MONEY ON THIS WORTHLESS ITEM, I LOOKED FURTHER AND PURCHASED THE AVERMEDIA MODEL 310, 4 RECORDABLE TUNERS AT ONE TIME, FOR REAL, AND ONLY $ 149.00 + SOME ADD. ITEMS YOU WILL NEED, BUY THE PACKAGE AND YOU WILL BE ONE VERYVERY HAPPY CAMPER !!!! BEST OF LUCK TO ALL...
customer_reviews.author: Jan Harde

customer_reviews.title: Glad I cut the cord.
customer_reviews.text: They kept raising the price so I cancelled Uverse TV - Now I'm saving $65.00 per month. Yhat will pay for the Tablo in less than a year. We weren't watching anything except Broadcast TV and streaming (Netflick & Hulu) anyway. Since we are over 50 miles from TV stations we had to install an outdoor antenna. Reception is great. Love the guide. Manual recording is the only problem. We normally use a Roku 3 but you can't record manually with that. I have to go to a Home Computer to schedule a manual record. That's essential during football season as the games seem to always disrupt the regular schedule.
customer_reviews.author: J. Dunn

customer_reviews.title: does a great job
customer_reviews.text: doing as good as I hoped it would----I cut my direct tv---we use amazon prime and net flix---and my new antenna tv----one station on antenna shows the old shows from the 60es and 70es I love to watch these so I record the ones I like and watch when I want----I added a 3tb wd extra hard drive to my tablo...--- tv signal has to be strong with low noise for the recorder to work----tablo help was good also--- after I adjusted my antenna to get the noise out of the signal every thing is good also the program guide is great-------I have only had my unit for about 3 weeks---I would buy again
customer_reviews.author: John G.

customer_reviews.title: Just about perfect for us
customer_reviews.text: We cut the cable. No DIRECTV and no satellite internet. But we missed is the ability to record shows, TV guide and pause live tv. Using the 4 channel Tablo, we get all that and more. Set up was easy using out Amazon Fire TV. I did learn that when downloading the guide, it can take 20-30 minutes to fully populate all the channels. I have one channel (Daystar) that didn't get updated in the guide. I opened a support ticket to get it added. I like the app on my iPhone and iPad, this way we can look for programs to record without using interrupting what, we're watching. I highly recommend getting a Tablo.
customer_reviews.author: H. T. Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Good picture and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Equipment arrived in a box inside padded envelope. No shipping damage. Setup was straightforward and worked in 10 min. Tested with a 128G USB stick. Interface was fast and picture was very good. App was very easy to use. I bought this to record Shows over the air so I can fast forward during commercials. Tablo was set up on a second floor room facing the broadcast antenna. Using Turk bar antenna indoors with amp enabled. Hooked up to LAN via Ethernet. Shows now available all over house that is within my WiFi range. Only using this for 2 days. So far very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Peterm

customer_reviews.title: I have been using it for about two weeks and it works well.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using it for about two weeks and had to reboot it last night for the first time. The connection somehow got lost but it didn't lose any shows or information. Be sure to budget in a 2TB storage device. Update: The product is a few months old now and still works as expected and the Tablo teem keeps bringing out updates that expand the capabilities. I am used to, you buy it it is yours, but the teem keeps improving the product. WOW
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Could NOT INSTALL
customer_reviews.text: Had high hopes for this in an attempt to “cut the cable”. Unfortunately, I updated the Tablo yet it would not install. Location services and even manually entering my zip code did not work.
customer_reviews.author: Lupo Lady, aka GADGET GIRL

customer_reviews.title: That couldn't be any easier
customer_reviews.text: I just got the antenna, followed the instructions. All three of them. Downloaded the app on my old iPhone and it worked great. Had to set the bandwidth to full to get a good clear picture, but I didn't really do much about the orientation of the antenna, I just pointed in the general direction of where I though the towers were. I don't know what else to say except that the app was great, my wife likes it. And she hated everything else.
customer_reviews.author: wicked willy

customer_reviews.title: Cord Cutter must have! With the new AppleTV app ...
customer_reviews.text: Cord Cutter must have! With the new AppleTV app, I can now stream local programming right to my TVs and iOS devices without a bunch of complicated equipment to connect to my TVs. Wife no longer has to ask for help switching TV inputs to watch what she wants. Note that without a subscription (free for the first 30 days), you can only watch live streaming. Subscription enables access to DVR functionality and expanded guide service. Basic guide service continues without subscription, but only gives current day's programming.
customer_reviews.author: R. Bowers

customer_reviews.title: Works great so far
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic product, if you can get good local channels from an antenna and have good WIFI. The extended guide is very good, making it easy to schedule recordings and worth the $5 a month. It does take several seconds to sync and start up the live TV channels. Viewing completely recorded shows is very good. It creates small visuals to let you skip around commercials or whatever with precision. Pausing and rewinding live TV is fine, but watching recorded shows is the best experience. I use this product mainly to watch TV with the Roku device app. So far, I am very impressed with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Birk

customer_reviews.title: Great cable cutter!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been up & running about a month. I have the 4 tuner, 2TB storage. I live about 10-15 miles S of Tampa. I get 58 channels. Great product. Easy to install. Excellent help desk. Some connectivity issues using Roku. I will work on those. Plenty of OTA entertainment. It’s nice needing just one dvr for all TVs and devices. I connect Tablo to router via Ethernet, not WiFi. Room & attic antenna work fine.
customer_reviews.author: C. Modrzejewski

customer_reviews.title: If you can get local channels in your area over antenna this is well worth buying.
customer_reviews.text: Works as good as I hoped it would. I also got the program guide and it is very easy to use, very similar to what I have with cable TV maybe better. I get local channels very well with my home made antenna so it's a good combination. Cable TV charges $20 for my local channels. This will pay for itself in less then a year. :-) This is a 4 channel recorder, they now are offering a new 2 channel recorder for under $150.
customer_reviews.author: mfarina01

customer_reviews.title: After 2 days, I was unable to connect to ...
customer_reviews.text: After 2 days, I was unable to connect to the box via my desktop. I tried all the so called trouble shooting and nothing worked. I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: William Little

customer_reviews.title: Way easier to use than I was expecting
customer_reviews.text: Set up was very easy. Bought the year's subscription to the TV channel listings and it was very simple to set it to record shows I wanted. Streams easily to other devices on my local network. Haven't tried streaming away from home yet. I recommend you get a very large external drive to connect to it since it doesn't have any built in storage.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Nichols

customer_reviews.title: Easy To Use, But Returned In Favor of HDHomeRun Quatro
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to install, but poor software, guide, encoding & video quality forced a return. The HDHomeRun Quatro is considerably better in everyway & it's cheaper! Their 14 Day guide & DVR service features are only $35 a year! Tablo is easy, but it's not quality unfortunately.
customer_reviews.author: Realistic Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Careful - Know What You are Actually Getting
customer_reviews.text: You're getting something....it's pretty unclear that you are not getting any storage with this device. If you order it, make sure to order storage as well. I set up with my HDTV Antenna. Without the Tablo I got ton's of channels even CBS, but when they antenna was connected through the Tablo I got only a fraction of the channels and no matter how I adjusted the antenna still couldn't get the channels I wanted. I returned this items. Too expensive not to include storage and not be able to get the channels I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Gina Kubie

customer_reviews.title: Once you get a good HDTV signal, it works
customer_reviews.text: Pro: Once you get a good HDTV signal, it works. Con: Wifi is only 2.5 Ghz. Android app is buggy with Chromecast V1. Setup is awkward since there were no manuals. Package appeared to be used: Box was unsealed. Power supply cord was unwrapped - not even a twister. No documentation whatsoever. I had a lot of issues getting the unit to find my hard drive, and had to unplug the drive numerous times. Pricey. Unknown: Does it support USB 3.0? What is the 2nd USB port for?
customer_reviews.author: Steve Woods

customer_reviews.title: If you want local for free, get a Tablo and good antennae.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great devise. I decided to cut the cable a few months ago and chose the Table as my option for local TV. The online apps that stream content have no-to limited local TV options. Tablo is awesome! I like the interface, it has a cable TV style guide. It connects easily and gives me the ability to stream free local stations without a lot of hassle and/or cost. Although the streaming services are starting to add local channels, I have had times where the streaming apps don't work so well (freezing, rebooting, etc.). I just go back to my Tablo and watch local channels! Hioghly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: T Yearg

customer_reviews.title: Great for Over The Air (OTA) Viewers
customer_reviews.text: Works as described and allows you to reord OTA broadcasts and watch them on any enabled device. Was odd that it requires a separate Hard Drive to store the shows. Should be built in. Works great as long as you have effectively captured the OTA signals with your antenna. A bit of trial end error to position antenna optimally and still get some cut off of shows due to "weak Signal"
customer_reviews.author: Jon Bauman

customer_reviews.title: Buffering is pretty much gone
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this in 2015 and could never got it to work properly. The biggest issue was constant buffering and lost connection to the unit. Gave it another try early this year since I was tired of paying 120+ for Sat TV. All the issues I mentioned above have been fixed. Buffering is pretty much gone. I think several things had help 1. probably better firmware. 2. I upgraded my home router so internal speed is north of 30 Mbps 3. Added an external Antennae in my attic. Overall, I'm happy with the unit. Cancelled my SatTV.
customer_reviews.author: HaiLeander

customer_reviews.title: Remote viewing can be tricky.
customer_reviews.text: Setting up remote (out of home) viewing MAY require changing setting in your router. My router is a newer Orbi by Netgear and it did not auto-connect with my new Tablo box. Tablo support sent me a link to the Orbi owners manual. The changes required are tricky for non-techs, and must be done while you are at home. This has to do with 'opening ports' which some folks feel can be a security risk. There is a 3rd party outfit that can help you for $40 (Port Forwarding.com) As far as I can tell Tablo does not support these configuration changes. At least in my case, Tablo is not Plug and Play. Kinda of disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: bukzin

customer_reviews.title: Tablo gets terrible reception!
customer_reviews.text: After installing Tablo and adding a hard drive for recordings, I found Tablo is constantly buffering on live TV and on recordings. Netflix and Amazon Prime have no issues, and Sling works well with an occasional buffering. But Tablo is terrible! I followed the suggestions to set the live and recording settings to HD 720 - 3 Mbps, but it is so irritating to have Tablo buffering every 30 seconds to 1 1/2 minutes and last for 30 seconds to minute before it stops buffering.
customer_reviews.author: sacpaw

customer_reviews.title: Pixelation and buffering nightmare
customer_reviews.text: I was really hoping to like this OTA DVR, but within a few hours the pixelation and buffering stalling forced me to return this box immediately.
customer_reviews.author: motees

customer_reviews.title: The Over-the-Air DVR I've always needed
customer_reviews.text: I've been waiting for someone to invent this for a while. I have used a computer with a TV tuner card for years and Windows Media Center to record TV but having a computer sitting next to a TV looks tacky. So far the Tablo checks all those boxes, it records over the air TV, isn't an eye sore next to the TV, AND it allows you to stream your recorded TV to multiple devices. You can do time shifting, advanced recording features, and remote scheduling. I've been very happy with this product so far.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan J Moffitt

customer_reviews.title: This was a good purchase for us.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this about2 to 3 years ago. It works great. I never do a review when I have just purchased a product. We have an antenna on the roof and great reception. Record all the shows we plan to watch. Never watch anything live. If you have good reception the tablo automatically skips all the commercials. It has great support. We had some reception issues and were able to communicate with support and get the issues resolved quickly. Cut the cord. We save 85.00 a month. About $3000 over last 3 years
customer_reviews.author: Donato P.

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT for cord cutters!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for and researching a good way to stream my Air TV (OTA) to my roku devices. This does that and so much more. I can watch live tv AND it has DVR after you attach a hard drive. I stream my live tv to my work pc, mac, and my phone and iPad. This works on Roku and AppleTV. I had a problem with the guide, and the support has been awesome to work with and they kept working until the problem was fixed. I HIGHLY recommend this product for anyone thinking of cutting the cable. A++ product.
customer_reviews.author: Scott H.

customer_reviews.title: Big step forward for basic antenna TV users, painful step backward for former satellite snobs
customer_reviews.text: First, I don't like that the price went down $50 since I bought it 2 weeks ago. Second, here's to the team at Tablo for what appears to be their resolve to really respond to their customers. Third, I really hope they are able to continue to update some rudimentary capabilities; the fast forward and rewind functions on a currently recording program (it's almost not worth the effort); the backspacing to the channel guide in less steps. Looking forward to updating this review, as I get used to the machine's limited capabilities, benefit from hoped for updates and lose sight of all the luxuries that satellite afforded (at a price.)
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Not ready for prime time. Look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.text: Conceptually this seems like a great component. We've had it for over a year for use in the summers when we don't have satellite reception at our location and need over the air TV. Last year it worked on a marginal basis and would drop the connection while watching live shows or recorded . Also, our TV tuner is able to easily pickup stations that the Tablo has trouble capturing. This spring Tablo did a major firmware upgrade that has made the unit all but useless. Constantly need to reboot or reset it to get connection. Connection will disappear and require going through the reinstall action process. In summary, one of my worst electronic investments.
customer_reviews.author: D. Harper

customer_reviews.title: Better products out there, lucky if I use 2 of the 4 tuners.  Inspired me to run more cable outlets in home.
customer_reviews.text: Slow loads and channel changes even with wired connection to router. It will not work with anything but an external hard drive;big disappointment when you already own a large NAS storage device for your home. I use this for remote location tv's that have no access to cable wiring and to record over air shows for later viewing. Software was not available for Samsung TV's at the time of review, so I have to run through Plex app as a channel.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: You MUST buy a hard drive to use this unit
customer_reviews.text: It was not clear to me, but I was going to use the unit just for live TV, not as a recorder. Without an external drive you can only watch one channel/stream at a time. To watch on more than one device or to record you must add a USB hard drive. The reception works great, the UI is a bit lacking. Great idea, wasn't quiet as easy/flawless as I had expected. Overall, it works for what it does.
customer_reviews.author: R. Ewing

customer_reviews.title: Adds Essential Functionality to OTA TV
customer_reviews.text: Performs exactly as described. Puts OTA signal on my home LAN where I can get at it using the Tablo app on a Roku or Fire TV streaming device. The Tablo app for Roku or Fire TV is terrific. I attached a USB hard drive to the Tablo for DVR functionality and the Tablo records the shows that I select. The automatic "commercial skip" is also terrific. I haven't tried the Amazon Recast device, but I can highly recommend the Tablo.
customer_reviews.author: T. Ferguson

customer_reviews.title: Really unacceptable unit service life!
customer_reviews.text: When these work, they work fine. Problem is I haven't had one (out of four) work longer than 9 months! One only lasted just over 30 days! I only keep buying them because I can't find an alternative to do the same job! I have ordered one more and it will be the last until someone in the factory figures out how to build a product that lasts for 3 or 4 years (never mind for the lifetime of the TV set!)
customer_reviews.author: Dione Greywolfe

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied with the Tablo device - it allows for recording Over-The-Air (OTA) TV shows.
customer_reviews.text: We are satisfied with the Tablo device - it allows us to record Over-The-Air (OTA) TV shows vis the antenna. Keep in mind it does require a separate external storage drive. It works directly with our antenna, or Apple TV, and ROKU. It can be a bit cumbersome to maneuver around but does what we need--allowed us to cut the cord from cable and satellite and still see our favorite network shows when we want. Also allows for fast forwarding through commercials.
customer_reviews.author: Retired

customer_reviews.title: it is a great concept. it can be improved considerably
customer_reviews.text: it is a great concept. it can be improved considerably. The app is not available on some new platforms which make me buy more TV STICKS, YUK!. the controls are rudimentary as they can be improved surfing the channels. it is long process to get to recordings. you have to read all the things they throw in front of it. still you cannot have recurring. you have explicitly click and click. and so on.
customer_reviews.author: MasterStylist

customer_reviews.title: You need Internet to use
customer_reviews.text: I would have prefer if I could use direct connection to tv rather than using Internet
customer_reviews.author: Thomas James Hargrave

customer_reviews.title: coord cutters dream come true
customer_reviews.text: love it. absolutely love it. we cut the coord with dish a month after we got this. at $100 a month with dish, we broke even on our ROI at 6 months, as we had to get another roku for the bedrrom, and then a hd antenna. we also got the lifetime guide thru tablo. with netflix and amazon prime, and then tablo, who needs cable? 18 months later, we have all the shows we want, and have pocketed $1200. its a win-win-win. (michael scott)
customer_reviews.author: NateR

customer_reviews.title: Tablo 4-Tuner Digital Video Recorder [DVR]
customer_reviews.text: Tuner sensitivity! My Samsung TV will pick up the channels on same antenna. I hookup to Tablo 4-Tuner Digital Video Recorder and scan. It will not pick up all channels. I did have a two channel version that would pick up and record the channels, but it would not work remotely. I want a 4 channel DVR , but am not happy with the sensitivity. I have looked for software updates and want to get it working.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works very well
customer_reviews.text: I had a notebook-sized hard drive from a computer that had failed. I mounted it in an external case which is connected to the Tablo with a "Y" cable that allows it to be powered by both USB ports, and that works very well. Having 4 tuners is a tremendous advantage. I have never had a case where a program couldn't record for lack of a tuner.
customer_reviews.author: BAP

customer_reviews.title: Look No Further.  This is the Unit you want.
customer_reviews.text: For those who want to cut the cord but don't want to give up time shifting, this is the unit you want. Along with my OTA antenna, Roku and Sling TV, I'm getting all of the channels that most people watch without the hassle of a big invoice each month and a gazillion channels you don't watch anyway. Oh yeah, you'll also need a portable hard drive. The savings from dropping your monthly bills for cable TV or DTV will pay for the components in 3 to 4 short months. It was such a thrill calling DTV and canceling my subscription. My wife is a big fan as well. She gets to record and watch all her soaps.
customer_reviews.author: Leno

customer_reviews.title: All 4 have broken within 3-4 weeks
customer_reviews.text: I've had 4, just ordered my 5th. EVERY SINGLE ONE lasted for about a month. After trying 1 more I will give up and buy a different brand. The features are great but they run very hot and last from 2-4 weeks before they quit working.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Deaux

customer_reviews.title: Can't find much not to love. Only issue is it seems to not pull ...
customer_reviews.text: Can't find much not to love. Only issue is it seems to not pull up marginal reception channels. I can watch my local PBS station on my tv with no real issues, the tablo won't find them half the time. They are weaker signal. I have used the streaming away from home feature. It had to be turned on and ports mapped on my router but it works fine. I found myself watching TV or recordings on my phone while taking care of our newborn.
customer_reviews.author: Lloyd I.

customer_reviews.title: 99 for Tivo and you don't have to get locked in to a long term contract like the Tivo (1 year for Tivo)
customer_reviews.text: Ok, so far I'm enjoying having whole home DVR with this single box. I can pause watching a recorded program in one room and resume it in another. I can watch on my tablets or phones (up to 6 people watching at once). You can't "channel surf" but right now that's ok. Monthly guide service is 5 bucks compared to 14.99 for Tivo and you don't have to get locked in to a long term contract like the Tivo (1 year for Tivo). I already had Roku and a Fire TV and an external hard drive so my initial cost was just the Tablo box. Look into it, you might like it.
customer_reviews.author: j. gaines

customer_reviews.title: THE BEST DVR EVER!
customer_reviews.text: Without a doubt, the best DVR available for a network in your home or office! I could spend hours talking about it, but installation was a snap, quality is supurb, and the damn think simply works! Far less expensive than a Tivo and no ridiculously high subscription fees! GET THIS MACHINE!
customer_reviews.author: Tom McElvy

customer_reviews.title: a near perfect OTA DVR
customer_reviews.text: This has been heaven for us to cut the cable cord. We have so many free digital channels available and this Tablo helps us time-shift the shows to our schedule. The only real issue we have is it doesn't always play super smoothly with our Chromecast which is our main way to watch tv. I'm hoping this is something they will fix with software updates because it works perfectly on the computer and mobile apps.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Gilbert

customer_reviews.title: The good: We can watch live TV and recorded programs ...
customer_reviews.text: A recent cord cutter here, this unit was problematic at first until I finally tweaked the antenna system to get strong reception on all of my local channels. If you have a problem getting the guide, try another local zip code for it to search. You will need to add an external USB hard drive to record on. The good: We can watch live TV and recorded programs on anything connected to our WiFi. (Roku, Chromecasts, Phones, Tablets, etc.) Record and playback just like cable dvr worked Easily fast forward through the commercials 4 tuners results in very limited conflicts. The bad: The unit gets hot. Make sure you place it where it will be well ventilated.
customer_reviews.author: r. Blondel

customer_reviews.title: I would buy again and have recommended to my family.
customer_reviews.text: I use it with my Roku ultra streaming box. It does a great job of recording my local tv programs, but commercial skip only works occasionally, probably due to my slow internet upload speeds. I am using Ethernet to connect all 4 of my TVs and there have not been any problems. The 2 week guide is a little slow to load at times, but, seems to be avvurate.
customer_reviews.author: The Gambles

customer_reviews.title: Great unit. Combined it with Roku stick
customer_reviews.text: Great unit. Combined it with Roku stick. Easier to program for recording than when I had satellite. I so recommend having a good internet speed for best performance. Cut the cord 3 days ago and do not miss it. Got 69 channels using a Mohu sky60 antenna, Tablo and Roku. Saving $91 a month. Wonderful decision. Live 30 to 50 miles from various towers.
customer_reviews.author: Jean Good

customer_reviews.title: I like it better than Tivo

It has worked great for the few weeks I have had it. I wish I would have went this path instead of the Tivo one in the past. It works as expected and time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: C. Rowell

customer_reviews.title: Great product, easy to use

Check out the options that work without the subscription to see if this device still works for you. We love the whole house streaming and mutli-channel recording and playback.

customer_reviews.text: Very beautiful graphics and layout. Unfortunately, the Tablo suffers from extremely slow operation and sync issues. The frustration level exceeded my patience and I ended up returning the Tablo. My best piece of advise is to carefully research the Tablo before buying. No doubt it has great potential and maybe with further updates it could become a must have, but for now it's just not quite there yet. The one saving grace about the Tablo is with the recordings. If you were to use the Tablo only to watch your recordings it would work very nicely in that capacity.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Works great and easy to setup!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to save money and drop my cable tv but still wanted a DVR.. I looked a lot of products and Tablo offered the best for what I was looking for.. I already had Amazon Fire TV at every TV and simply installed the app and can now watch live or recorded TV.. The app on the FireTV works great. The initial setup of the device was so easy and making changes is easy as well. I have had 3 people watching the box at 1 time without any lag or buffer. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Matt S

customer_reviews.title: this is perfect. had a little hiccup with the guide but ...
customer_reviews.text: for an optional $5 a month, this is perfect. had a little hiccup with the guide but contacted them and eventually got it all sorted. easy to set up and programming shows to record. the only downside is it only give a 24-hour guide.
customer_reviews.author: lucy

customer_reviews.title: This provides more tv than most poeple can take the time towatch. We will be purchasing a second for our ...
customer_reviews.text: We are very much utilizing the Tablo 4 tuner for off the air viewing as well as recording. It allows one antenna connection then distributes the signal via internet to additional tvs. The surprise are the additional apps available for viewing at no additional charge. This provides more tv than most poeple can take the time to watch. We will be purchasing a second for our second home. Having said all this, we are giving it 4stars instead of 5 for it's interface, which has to load channels when changed. Not for the channel suffer.

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent

Sometimes it looks like show recorded but when you try to play it back it gives an error message or won't play. Hoping a future update will improve things.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Plourd

customer_reviews.title: I Am Still Waiting
customer_reviews.text: I received this product yesterday. I connected it to an HD antenna and downloaded all the proper apps etc. At this moment my effort to "Cut the Cord" is a disaster. I do not know whether the problem is this product or my over-the-air antenna or what. But for what it is worth, leaving Comcast or DISH or DIRECTV is not as simple as some people might claim.
customer_reviews.author: McReviewer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to setup and use
customer_reviews.text: Easy to setup and use. Ditched the cable bill and went with an off air antenna. Looking forward to hours and hours of recording on the 4TB drive we added. Going to be great with football and fall season of new shows coming up. The device works well and I stream via Wi-Fi to three different televisions (TCL televisions since you can use the TV App) and also to my computer with no issues thus far. Glad to not be paying a monthly rental for a cable or satellite DVR box. I did sign up for the extended guide data - 2 weeks of data.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew  G

customer_reviews.title: Great when it works
customer_reviews.text: My Tablo 4-tuner worked great for a week, but then became very glitchy and unreliable. I worked with Tablo's Tech Support for a month to resolve the technical issues, but could never fully fix them. I ultimately returned the unit. The interface and features were wonderful and did everything that I wanted. But there were issues with disconnecting from the network, unit detection, lost sound, failed recordings, and playback errors. The 4-tuner DVR also got extremely hot by design. I placed it on blocks and a cooling fan base to dissipate the heat.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 4 tuner digiat video recorder
customer_reviews.text: The name is misleading, there is no vdr , however it allows you to attach a hard drive. I use an external laptop hard drive. Doesn't need to be plugged into the wall and connects with Alexa with no issues. Not connected to the television, it connects to Alexa Cube that is plugged in the television. This devise is worth getting.
customer_reviews.author: Russ G.

customer_reviews.title: Works great, but set up needs some technical support.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a new cord cutter and was recommended to the Tablo. I had some difficulty setting it up, in fact I returned my first unit for a replacement. Technical support was most helpful, and my unit is now generally working, but still have not got the guide showing more than 1 day forward. customer_reviews.author: Mr. Terence J. Dalton

customer_reviews.title: Hook it up, cancel your cable subscription and never look back.
customer_reviews.text: I was looking up the Tablo for a friend and realized that I purchased mine 3 years ago. I can't say enough good things about this unit. It has performed almost flawlessly since I installed it. Had a few minor glitches in the beginning. I would highly recommend this product to anyone interested in saving a small fortune by cutting the cord. I travel for work often and love the remote access feature.
customer_reviews.author: Michael M Clemmons, NC

customer_reviews.title: I have mixed feelings about this. Their customer service ...
customer_reviews.text: I have mixed feelings about this. Their customer service is top notch and it is a promising product, but it still has some work to do. I invested in the lifetime guide subscription, because I'm excited about what they are trying to do. I only gave them 4 stars due to the issues I have ran into with its incompatibility with roku (roku buffering issue, nothing Tablo can do about it). I am looking to purchase a fire stick and if it works as the Tablo did originally I will bump this up to 5 star.

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with my Tablo
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with my Tablo! I bought the lifetime subscription and record shows for my kids as well as all the local shows I want to see. Dropped Direct TV and am so glad I did. Picked up Sling TV for the network shows and sports that I need. Tablo works great on both Roku2 devices that I have and it works over Plex as well. Can't wait for the Tablo app to come out for the Apple TV. Tablo does exactly what it advertises!
customer_reviews.author: J HICKS

customer_reviews.title: Cut the Cord
customer_reviews.text: After having our cable bill rise over the years we tried a dish, and the same thing happened. So we cut the cord and now rely on Tablo for our local channels. I even use a homemade antenna so it didn't cost us anymore to get a very usable interface for our OTA TV. Provides a great picture for free.
customer_reviews.author: Gratzman

customer_reviews.title: Amazingly good!
customer_reviews.text: This OTA recorder system is absolutely fantastic. I read all of the reviews and I have no idea why anyone would not love this product. It works great. Easy to set up, easy to use. Simple and informative menu system. What's not to like! Oh, after I tried the 2-tuner version I bought another.
customer_reviews.author: AR

customer_reviews.title: Another cord cutter essential!
customer_reviews.text: I love this product! If you are a cord cutter and can set up a digital OTA antenna then this is for you! Tons of free OTA TV! And, you can record at your leisure. Uses a minuscule amount of bread band bandwidth also! And this unit allows multiple simultaneous TV access (bought the dual unit as well that doesn't do this). Even allows for away from home viewing! Luv this unit!
customer_reviews.author: SFC

customer_reviews.title: Great product, hope they will continue to improve the speed/performance.
customer_reviews.text: I cancelled my dish tv service and switch to an OTA with this DVR. Have had it for a couple of months and after tweaking some initial settings, it seems to be working very well. I am getting great reception on all local channels. DVR is working very well. I paid the subscription to get the full featured guide (as it was very convenient to manage the recordings). I am hoping that Tablo will continue to improve the device with software/firmware updates to speed up load/buffer times. Overall, I am very happy with it and it's a great replacement for paid tv service.
customer_reviews.author: eBuyer

customer_reviews.title: OTA DVR for the Whole House
customer_reviews.text: Tablo made cord cutting so simple for the WHOLE house. One antenna and install the app on all our FireSticks and bingo: OTA + DVR on all TVs. Add a streaming service for the premium stuff you want (if any) and you are set and you don't need to be changing sources back and forth to the antenna. Everything is right there on your streaming input. It works. I even signed up for the guide service and it's worth the few $ per month for the guide and recording select ease. Think of it as a TIVO server for the whole house rather than one TV!
customer_reviews.author: KCL

customer_reviews.title: Cut the cord

I have tons of TVs everywhere and can get local channels for free thru a firestick at ea TV. Add Direct TV Now (internet version) and get all the rest of the channels for $40 more bucks per mo with DVR in the cloud. Love it.

customer_reviews.author: Judy D.

customer_reviews.title: Great way to record OTA TV and stream to mobile devices as well

The Tablo can record multiple shows and I purchased the 4 tuner model so it can record 2 shows or more and still stream to a device. I love it works well and they seem to keep firmware updates coming to keep it working well. I would recommend it for cord cutters or anyone who wants to record OTA TV.

Every thing that could be done to get it started again failed. Obviously if you can't connect your debugging choices are limited. I contacted tech support and followed their debugging instructions faithfully and got it fixed. If DIY doesn't work, call for support. Back to good working condition.

customer_reviews.text: It's good as long as you know the limitations. First of all, if you had to have a true TV surfing on a single TV, I would recommend TiVo Roamio OTA with lifetime subscription. customer_reviews.title: So far I love it. It did skip recording a "new" episode ...
customer_reviews.text: Had it about 11 days now. So far I love it. It did skip recording a "new" episode of one show for no apparent reason. I chalk that up to some problem with the program guide data. I changed that scheduled recording to record "all" episodes (since it's a reality show that won't have any re-runs). product_meta.title: Tablo 4-Tuner Digital Video Recorder [DVR] for Over-The-Air [OTA] HDTV with Wi-Fi for LIVE TV Streaming
product_meta.description: Style:SingleTablo is a 4-Tuner Over-The-Air (OTA) DVR for Cord-Cutters using HDTV antennas to access broadcast TV signals. All Tablo units include dual band Wi-Fi enabling Tablo and the antenna to be placed in an optimal location for OTA reception. Browse, record and stream up to four simultaneous live or recorded HDTV programs on your iPad, Android tablet, laptop, smartphone, or your big screen TV using Roku, Chrome cast or Apple TV. A Whole-Home-DVR and place shifter combined, Tablo streams your favorite HDTV programs including local news and sports to all connected devices on your home network or anywhere you have internet. Setup- It's easy to start enjoying free Over-the-Air TV with a 4-Tuner Tablo OTA DVR. Here's how- Connect your HDTV Antenna. Connect a USB Hard Drive - required both for streaming live TV and recording. Connect Tablo to your Home Network - via WiFi or Ethernet. Connect the Power Adapter
feature_bullets: Cancel cable, keep the DVR: Watch, pause, and record live antenna TV. Browse upcoming shows, schedule and manage recordings. Skip commercials, fast-forward and rewind recordings.

Whole-home networked DVR: Tablo has no HDMI connection. It connects to your router instead of your TV to let you browse, record, and stream live over-the-air (OTA) TV to any device, anytime, anywhere. (Out-of-home streaming requires an active Tablo guide data subscription, optional, sold separately).
Dual-band AC Wi-Fi included: The only OTA DVR with Wi-Fi, Tablo lets you position the DVR and TV antenna for the best OTA TV signal reception. (TV antenna required, sold separately).

Enjoy your favorite network TV channels via Tablo apps on your iOS & Android mobile devices, computers, Smart TVs, streaming media & gaming devices, incl. Roku, Fire TV, Android TV, Apple TV, NVIDIA SHIELD TV, and Xbox.
Flexible USB Storage: Connect as much recording capacity as you want, up to 8TB (USB hard drive required to store recordings and play multiple live streams simultaneously. Sold separately).
